82.name: The Annexe
direction: We are a black timber-clad annexe on pretty East End Lane, a few minutes' walk from the centre of the village, and can be accessed by either Lewes Road or The High Street.
description: A new venue this year, we have an eclectic mix of abstract and figurative paintings as well as jewellery.

Penny Sanderson is inspired by the natural world and describes her style as botanical, but not as you know it.
John Herbert is an artist who does not know where he is coming from, or where he’s going to, but is busy trying to find the answer.
Maxwell Attenborough MA (RCA) uses different media to capture fleeting moments.
Joanna Clinch is showing playful paintings and delicate handmade jewellery.

the-wolf-at-the-door-2.name: The Wolf at the Door
direction: Close to Hove Station. Over the footbridge and straight up the road; you'll see the Wolf on the r.h.side near Old Shoreham Rd. Nearest bus no.7, also 21 and 56.
description: Air, Light, Space. House and garden will be open. Warm welcome, bright spaces, wonderful art. Browse, sit, enjoy the tranquillity – and famed refreshments.

Andrew Jones Air and Magic: kinetic art
Si Uwins  Alien Nature: wood sculpture
Michelle Cobbin Zen-inspired abstract paintings
Penny May Stone carving
Antony Penrose Sculpture, books
Jill Tattersall (host) Paints, inks, pigments, handmade paper
tablebrighton Divine refreshments, culinary gifts

Extra events: Antony Penrose, Neil Jenkins (6th, 20th May), more.
Private opening by appointment

bmecp.name: BMECP
direction: In the corner of Fleet Street and New England Street coming from Sainsburys.
description: Black and Minority Ethnic Community Partnership (BMECP), a charitable trust, provides a space for the community from different cultures and backgrounds to meet and share their skills and knowledge. It champions BME groups and others such as migrants, refugees, and asylum seekers. Near Brighton Station, it opens its doors for the first time, to display a broad variety of disciplines by local amateur and professional artists.

The exhibition will guide you to an array of exciting visual delights bursting with passion, subtlety and creativity. You will have the opportunity to see local artist Emily Jolly demonstrating watercolour painting on Sunday 7th from 2.00 to 4.00 pm.
Also exhibiting is Lester E M Springer an internationally renowned Cuban artist, who has a unique and dramatic style, which incorporates Rastafarian influences in its celebration of the female form.
You will be able to meet some of the artists whilst enjoying tasty ethnic snacks in the BMECP café. Disabled access is available.

dion-salavdor-lloyd.name: Dion Salvador Lloyd
direction: Down from Hove train station towards George Street on the right hand side
description: Welcome to the home and studio of Dion Salvador Lloyd. This will be his 17th year of Open House and he will be exhibiting new contemporary landscape oil paintings alongside new limited edition prints. Visitors will see how Dion surrounds himself with sensory inspiration, nature, collected and found objects and hear the music that inspires his work.
Recent achievements: selected and hung at The ING Discerning Eye 2016 and The Royal West of England Academy (RWA) 2016.
Represented by Belgravia Gallery and Northcote in London and Edgar Modern in Bath.

14-st-heliers-2.name: 14 St Heliers
direction: Off Portland Road - opposite West Hove Junior School
description:
Stuart Smith Paintings and constructions
Sophie Rankin Photography and illustration
Tina O’Donnell Silver jewellery
Lorna Casey Stained glass
Robert Matusiewicz Woodbits
Anna Smith Textiles
hello terry Jewellery design
Claire Flowers Earrings
Vicki Heape Ceramics
Chris Heape Ceramics

New this year -1o guest artists with demos:
Carling Chen, Sally Dutton-Newman, Lucy Smith, Jenn Adamson, Janet Ballard, Penny Marler, Ann Gillman, Pauline O’Reilly, Claire Harris, Isla Willat
And refreshments in the garden.

room-with-a-view.name: A Room With A View
direction: 'Embassy Court' is the Modernist block of flats opposite the 'Peace Statue' and 'Meeting Place Cafe' on the seafront.
East of the i360 and The Bandstand.
This event is via pre booking only. Details on our website: www.humanfromearth.com
You will be sent access details upon booking. Thank you!'
description: Most of you will want to visit just to have a cuppa and look at the views. Please do!
I am using this AOH festival as a catalyst to give birth to various projects:
Bathroom – installation The Discusssion.

Studio – projects outlined:
Interview, art and festival project Human From Earth.
Illustrated kids book, guerilla art concept and new creative business.

Living Room Nothing For Sale.
This is my ‘headspace room’ – so I’m leaving it like that for you.

Bedroom Past Lives: exerts from my previous business North Laine Photography.

Limited visitor numbers, pre booking essential.
Please visit the website for details.

122-stanford-avenue.name: 122 Stanford Avenue
direction: 122 Stanford Avenue is located at the top of Stanford Ave, between the Dry Cleaners on the corner and the children's nursery. I will put bunting outside the venue too, fixed above head height.
description: A chance to see a selection of new photographic work from Benedict Ainscough, in both black & white and colour, inside the former local police HQ ‘police box’, situated in the heart of Fiveways.
Benedict Ainscough Photography

phoenix-brighton-2.name: Phoenix Brighton
description: For one weekend only, Phoenix Brighton opens its studio doors to some of Brighton’s best known and internationally renowned visual artists and makers. It offers a rare and exclusive glimpse into the creative work-spaces of painters, photographers, ceramicists, printers and many more.

Make the most of a chance to talk directly to the artists and the opportunity to buy a unique artwork fresh from the studio. Enjoy authentic Spanish food from Ole Ole’s pop-up cafe, as you browse this fascinating event for all the family.

Late night Opening:
Friday 12th May, 6pm – 9pm
Weekend Open:
Saturday 13th & Sunday 14th, 11am – 5pm

Exhibitions:
North Gallery Present Tense
South Gallery Artists at Phoenix; Portraits by Manel Ortega

bambi-brown-zona-rosa.name: Bambizart at Zona Rosa
direction: Zona Rosa, formerly known as Spinelli's is situated in Kemptown village, just a stones throw from Lloyds Bank.
description: A solo show of works, ranging from portraits and patterns of flowers inspired by Georgia O’Keeffe to sociopolitical pieces. Prints and cards for sale.
Tea, coffee, cakes and delicious Mexican food available.
Bambi Brown Digital and mixed media

comicpopup-brighton.name: Comicpopup Brighton
direction: The Hanover Pub on Queens Park Road - Buses 18, 21 and 23 stop outside
description: COMICS AS ART: from limited edition small press, to hand-crafted art books, this family-friendly pub is the perfect venue to pick up some fine reading matter to enjoy over a pint and a pizza. Selling work by a plethora of cartoonists from Brighton and beyond. Live sketching and Manga portraits plus cheap children’s comics.

More than 100 titles from artists including: Joe Decie, Fraser Geesin, Jaime Huxtable, Chie Kutsuwada, Michi Mathias, Douglas Noble, Paul O’Connell, Simon Russell, Zara Slattery, Inko Ai Takita, Myfanwy Tristram, Ian Williams and many more (full list on our Facebook page).
One day only: Saturday 13th May

francesca-grace-mcleod-3.name: Francesca Grace McLeod
direction: Turn towards the sea at the Taj Grocers traffic lights on Western Road.
description: Francesca is showing a selection of works on paper, canvas and aluminium sheet. Both landscape and figurative work feature in this year’s show, however Francesca’s most recent pieces capture the important, fleeting and sometimes intimate moments between people. Using old family photo albums as inspiration, this exhibition aims to depict old memories and celebrate human connections.

bluebell-would-4.name: Bluebell Would
description: Whether buying or just browsing, enjoy a warm welcome at Bluebell Would with its relaxed atmosphere and a range of arts and crafts to suit most tastes and budgets.

Bluebell Roebuck Photography, textile crafts and jewellery
Ruth Mullan Stained and fused glass
Margaret McGregor Betts Collagraphs, etchings and watercolours
Vicky Scott Illustration
Del Thorpe Illustration
Leonor Berdichevsky Watercolours
Alexis Rayner Painting and crafts
Refreshments available for a donation to local charity Kitty in the City.

field.name: FIELD HOUSE
direction: From Brighton, follow Lewes Road north, through the Vogue Gyratory, past the B&Q retail park on left. If driving, turn left immediately after the FIELDBTN pink wall and follow signs  for The Wood Store. Entrance for pedestrians is the red tunnel at the front, facing Lewes Road.
description:
Come and view our first Open House at FIELD; a hub of local Brighton makers and entrepreneurs who have inspired the collections on display.

The FIELD cafe and garden are open for refreshments, and our on-site shop the Wood Store is showing artwork from reclaimed materials.

Featuring various workshops and events from our guest artists plus creative upcycling from Brighton Bike Hub, Remade in Brighton and Brighton Repair Cafe; please see our website for details.

the-shed-on-the-beach.name: The Shed on the Beach
direction: Beach Hut 137 is approximately 200m West of  The Lawns Cafe and about 50m East of Fourth Avenue
description: The Shed on the Beach is a beach-hut studio, adjacent to Hove Lawns, showing the recent work of three local artists:
Charlie Day Abstract seascapes, oil on board
Tori Day Still life, oil on board
Paul Tuppeny Figurative works, oil on board

the-family-line.name: The Family Line
direction: 5 minutes walk from Brighton main line station to the 7 dials. Then North on Dyke Road, turn second left onto Addison Road.
description:
Shyama Ruffell Contemporary floral and jungle themes, painting, collage, prints and cards
Colin Ruffell Paintings prints and cards
Fran Slade Paintings prints and cards
Holly Bell Handmade functional ceramics
Frances Doherty Ceramic sculpture
Philippa Stanton Still life photography and products
Tim Mason Quirky collectables and funky furnishings

Exhibition throughout the house, garden and studio. Enjoy the wide range of unique and original art works and collectables –
with gorgeous food from Table Georgette.
Something for everyone.

abigail-bowen.name: Abigail Bowen
direction: Just 2 minutes walk up from Brighton Station. Leave the station, turn right up the hill (Guildford Road). Pass the Battle of Trafalgar Pub on your right and Clifton Street is the first road on the right.
description: Moving between figurative and abstract approaches, Abigail’s work varies from simple outdoor sketches to more involved pieces, exploring subjects such as dementia, memory loss and the domestic.
Her work is characterised by a rich palette of mainly darker tones and dramatic composition. Abigail has previously shown as part of Snug Open House in Hove. This is her first solo Open House.
Abigail was born in Brighton and graduated in Fine Art (Painting) from Chelsea College of Art in 1996.

art-indian-tapas-2.name: Art & Indian Tapas
direction: Worcester Villas is the last Road in Hove before Portslade. Worcester Villas is directly opposite Portslade train station. Buses that stop every 5 to 10 minutes at the bottom of the road are numbers 1, 1A, 49.
description: Take yourself on an aromatic, taste and visual journey through Gill and Hannah’s photography, complimented by Anita and Sarala’s pop-up Indian Cafe, selling a range of Goan tapas delights.

Immerse yourself in Gill’s long term project to take A Photograph Every Day For The Rest Of Her Life, now completing it’s second year. View Hannah’s latest black & white photography in the summer house – and relax in the tea-garden.

sussex-county-arts-club-2.name: Sussex County Arts Club
direction: Find the Costa coffee shop in Bond Street. Directly opposite Costa's is an alley. You will see a large sign with our name on it at the end of the alley (about 30 paces).
description: The Sussex County Arts Club’s annual summer exhibition showcases artwork produced by club members in a variety of media, much of it created during some of the many sessions run throughout the year at the club. We offer a variety of sessions for all abilities from beginners to professionals.
Please check our website for more details.

no-51.name: Art at No.51
description: We are a new house – opening for first time in 2017!

Rosie Clayden Jewellery
Chris Durham Photography
Keziah Furini Digital art
Rachel Lemon Drawings and ceramics
Colleen Slater Photography
Miles Whitaker-Durham Paintings
We look forward to welcoming you with a diverse selection of contemporary art and delicious cake.

studio-1.name: Julie Nelson
description: Artist Julie Nelson has created a sculpture installation called Flock for one weekend in a beautiful house on Grand Avenue, from 20th to 21st May. Flock references the long and intimate relationship the city has with birds. The multitude of elegant hand-sculpted forms that fill the space evoke themes such as migration, diversity and the interactions between nature and the built environment. Flock is a collaboration between Julie Nelson and Cameron Contemporary Art.
Julie Nelson Ceramic sculpture

at-the-coach-house-3.name: At the Coach House
description:
Annie Kerr Hand made books
Margaret Shillan Painter
Louise Antoinette Smith Maker
Lindsey Pearson Watercolour painter
Jane Hawkins Sketcher, painter and printmaker
Darryl Black Upcycled clothing, designer/maker
Barbara Alcock Painter
Lucia Babjakova Driftwood artist

The Coach House again presents  a fabulous variety of artists, makers and creators! During this festival there will be workshops, talks and happenings, along with tea, cake and jollyment… But first you must venture up this drive!

For what’s on, visit our website.

dorothy-stringer-school-2.name: Dorothy Stringer School
description: Come and meet the artists and designers of the future. A wide range of work in both two and three dimensions will be displayed from both the Art and Technology departments. Our AOH is part of a larger Spring Festival; there will be music and theatre, charity and produce stalls, environmental groups and positive action organisations. Make a day of it and visit all schools on the campus.
This year we would especially like to invite ex-students to join us and meet up with old school friends. For more details regarding alumni contact the school.
Saturday 20th May, 10.30-4.00pm.

jemma-day-artist-in-residence.name: Jemma Day-Artist in Residence
direction: Access to my studio is via the Fish Gates on Temple Gardens. (Walk towards the Sports Centre and the entrance is on your left)
description:
I am the Artist in Residence at Brighton & Hove High School GDST.

Please come along to my studio to see my new paintings. In the series called The Stacks I use symbols to create abstract images using oil paint on paper, board and canvas.

Jemma Day Abstract oil paintings

The school has an outstanding reputation for the visual arts, consistently achieving exceptional results for both A level and GCSE and is the perfect backdrop for my work. I also run regular workshops for students across the whole range of year groups.

Access to my studio is via the Fish Gates on Temple Gardens.

229-studio-4.name: 229 Studio
direction: Find our little seafront Arch in the Brighton Artists Quarter. We're on the beach opposite the Thistle hotel near the lovely old Carousel.
description:
If sun, sea and fun aren’t enough, we’ve plenty to tempt you down to Brighton beach at 229 Studio.  Our sweet seafront arch is full of fresh new work with a local flavour.  Find us near the Carousel.

Brighton cool meets Swedish style in Ulrika Jarl’s exquisitely illustrated designs.  Holly Bell captures the beauty of our coastline in her tactile hand-thrown ceramics.  Find a fresh perspective on our local landscape in Sarah Jones amazing artwork.  And Mike Moran serves up quirky ceramics with the smile baked in.

Wish you were here!

adrian-walker-arts-2.name: Adrian Walker Arts
description: Once more, a chance to get a first look at new works in oil from this popular and increasingly successful artist. This year expect the addition  of some much larger oil paintings and also a series of framed editioned prints, strictly limited to 75 per edition, to accompany the more standard sized oils of previous years. As usual, seasoned trail-goers and curious newcomers alike will be warmly welcomed to a lovely space which is the perfect setting for some thoroughly enchanting work.

screen-art-printmaking-workshop.name: screen-Art Printmaking Workshop
direction: We are easy on the bus, from town/station take 1, 1a and 7 stop at the Lidl and walk back the way the bus has come to Arundel Place on the left, walk down Arundel Place, take the first left down Eastern Place and you will see us half way down on the right.

From the sea front take the 12, 12a, 13, 14 or 27 and get off at Arundel Terrace and walk east and turn left up Arundel Road, turn left in to Arundel Place and follow the road up on your right is Eastern Place.
You can park in the street on a meter or there is parking in Arundel Mews.
description:
What can you see through the round window? screen-Art Printmaking Workshop.
Welcome to our new screen printing studio in Kemptown, Brighton. Housed in an old dairy, we offer screen printing courses in both paper and fabric and open access facilities for those who have the experience to work without tutor support. Come and visit our friendly studio, bathed in orange and light, introduce yourself to the four screen beds and join us in ‘putting the soul in screen’.

the-encaustic-workshop.name: The Encaustic Workshop
description: Tony Owers is an experienced artist, currently working and offering weekend workshops in encaustic painting. One of the attractions of hot wax painting is the variety of techniques that can be used, its flexibility and immediacy. Weekend courses, £150pp with all materials and light lunch provided.

encounters-2.name: Encounters
description: This year Encounters presents the curated show Urban Sights. Twelve artists delight your senses through artistic encounters with the urban experience.

Digital artist Elizabeth Cemborain constructs synthetic landscapes from multiple images.
Photographer Beatriz Eggli combines features of cities into narrative montages.
Painter Garcia-Garcia explores quintessential structures and photographer Ricardo Jimenez muses on connections between city life and the natural world.
The musical soundscape of Andres Sanchez delves deep into the question ‘Is urbanity soulless?’
Painter Rafael Reveron explores construction and de-construction and Victoria Gomez provides insight into shapes that convey fragility and forcefulness.
Installation artist Miladys Parejos installation Emptiness explores a dichotomy between the current economic narrative vs. social/ political realities.
Annemette Beck shows how uniformity can be vanquished by purity of design.
Lise Moller brings artistic life to giant seaweed.
Marion Brandis brings her sculptural seagulls to enrich the native population.
Carlos Sanchez pays tribute to the environment with his jewellery work, Im-pact.

77-ditchling-rise.name: Nature versus Nurture
description: Come and explore this newly decorated Open House, specialising in works of intricacy. The exhibiting artists have an eye for detail and there will be a varied array of work on show. Enjoy refreshments in the garden while you’re there.
Inspired by nature, influenced by nurture, intertwined with humour.

Izzie Roffe-Silvester Jewellery, paintings, reclaimed wood
Charlotte Roffe-Silvester Watercolour and gouache paintings
Claire Silvanna Cullen Print designer and artist
Zoe Charlotte Surface pattern designer and illustrator
Small Woolly Elephant Animal sculptures and potted plants

ilana-richardson-guests-2.name: Ilana Richardson & Guests
direction: Just off New Church Road, bus stop at Richardson Road
description: Sun-drenched paintings of the Mediterranean to warm your heart – feel instantly transported to hot, sunny places. After many years of exhibiting in London and world-wide, Ilana warmly welcomes you to her house.

Ilana Richardson Paintings and prints

the-ceramic-gardener-friends.name: The Ceramic Gardener + friends
direction: Bus 5b to bottom of Beaconsfield villas
description: This year we are excited to have two new artists to compliment the house. Alan works with me on collaborative sculpture and will be showing his amazing animals. Alice is a former student of mine who will be showing her collection for the first time. Jane and Charlie are firm favourites and will be showing new work.  We also have a front garden sculpture trail leading to the house.

Frances Doherty Colourful ceramic sculpture
Jane Denman Acrylic paintings
Charlie High Silver jewellery
Alice Stewardson Ceramics
Alan Williams Recycled metal sculpture

breezier-no-46-2.name: Breezier No. 46

direction: Coming out of Brighton on Dyke Rd, take the first right after the Church of the Good Shepherd, and then first left into Tivoli Crescent. We are on the right opposite Tivoli Place, a private road with bollards across it.

Exciting art on three floors.

orange-dog-yellow-wheels.name: Red Brick House
description: Red Brick House opens for the first time, showing the work of four artists who successfully collaborated last year in the Windmill Collective.

Visitors will have the opportunity to see a working artist’s studio, buy original paintings, framed drawings, giclee prints, greetings cards, artist books, zines, jewellery, hand appliqué cushions, embroideries, clothing, ceramics and …cakes!

Sophie Wake Gouache, ink, oils and print
Lee Needham Abstraction and landscape
Rogelio Gastelu Fabric applique and homewares

the-coal-hole.name: The Coal Hole
direction: The Coal Hole is located on the corner of Albion Hill and Holland Street, just a short walk from town. If walking here from the Level head up either Albion Hill or Southover Street and come down the cross street of Holland Street.
description: This architect renovated corner house was a former coal shop, it is now home to Georgina Smith who creates unique 3D relief paintings. Joining her will be an eclectic mix of artists and makers. Browse our wares, then enjoy a drink and a cake in the sunny garden.

Georgina Smith Relief painting

no-90.name: No.90
direction: Opposite the Wild Cherry Delicatessen.
description: A new venue in Queens Park, Kemptown. Three experienced artists exhibiting at Artists Open Houses for the first time, showing a wide-ranging and original collection of contemporary sculpture, photography, prints, painting and sign-writing. Plus colourful, patterned jewellery by Brighton maker Hello Terry.

art-in-2017.name: Artists At 3
direction: Next to Preston Park, opposite the Park View pub and next door to St Mary's Catholic Church.
description: The Spaces In Between.
We welcome the return of Colin Moore and the addition of three other established artists.  Together with two young debut artists they join our core group in our light and roomy exhibition space.

Martin Brown Semi-abstract painting, based on imaginative spaces

Fran Brown Playful fused glass creations

Rhiannon West Garden mosaic structures

17a-st-georges-road.name: Workshop No.17
direction: Above The Vintage Workshop, Kemptown Village
description: Situated above The Vintage Workshop, is where it all happens. We are opening up to the public for the first time, showcasing artists, makers, jewellers, print-makers, photographers and a tinker. Celebrating past, present, future.

bip-art-printmaking-workshop-2.name: bip-Art Printmaking workshop
direction: We are easy on the bus, from town/station take 1, 1a and 7 stop at the Lidl and walk back the way the bus has come to Arundel Place on the left, walk down Arundel Place until you see Arundel Mews on your left, the workshop has flowers and a bench outside.

From the sea front take the 12, 12a, 13, 14 or 27 and get off at Arundel Terrace and walk east and turn left up Arundel Road, turn left in to Arundel Place and follow the road up until you see the Mews on your right.
We also have a free carpark or there is pay on street parking
description:
What does bip-Art stand for?
Brighton inspiring printmakers?
Brilliant interesting pictures?
Believing in people?
Brings inner peace?
It means all of these things and more. We are a Brighton based printmaking workshop, offering day, evening and weekend courses for adults and children, along with open access facilities for printmakers. Visit bip-Art printmaking workshop, see the presses in action, artists at work, printmaking demonstrations, cake and creative chat. Easy parking, dogs welcome.

the-studio-college-road.name: The Studio – College Road
direction: From St James Furnishing (corner of St George's Road and College Road) go north 20m (away from the sea). The studio is in the rear of the yard entered through the gateway on your left.
description: Visitors are invited to a studio in the heart of Kemptown, where the work of four artists is on show. Uniting it is a desire to create works of art built up from light, colour and mass, yet each approach to the challenge of abstraction is quite different.

Nick Philo uses paint and surfaces to re-create cosmic space; Maggie Philo uses surfaces to reveal natural processes; Ian Boutell works with perspex and paper to make structures of light and Michael Hutley uses pattern and colour to make visual music.

christine-and-poppys-house.name: Christine and Poppy’s House
direction: Bottom of St Aubyns, across the road from King Alfred's Sports Centre. Top of St Aubyns is near Hove Tesco's
description: Exhibiting in our small but bijou flat!

Christine Oram Mixed media 3D figures
Poppy Skelley Acrylic paintings and mixed media

eloise-nash-and-friends.name: Eloise Nash Ceramics & friends
description: Eloise Nash is opening up her working ceramics studio to exhibit her work alongside other artists. For the first year of opening her studio, Eloise has organised a variety of different exhibitors including photography, illustration, jewellery and ceramics.

Dominic Smith Photography
Eloise Nash Ceramics
JAM Jewellery Mixed media, jewellery
Susie Calvert Illustration

patcham-arts-2.name: Patcham Arts
direction: Patcham Community is located in the centre of Patcham accessible by bus and car.  The bus services are 5, 5A and 56.  If using services 5 or 5A ask for Patcham Clock Tower or by service 56 ask for Ladies Mile Road and the stop outside the Community Centre.  There are limited parking spaces at the Community Centre but good road parking in the area

Judy Alexander Mixed media

Juliet Wallage Fabric
Free workshops each weekend.

glass-in-fusion-4.name: Glass In Fusion
direction: The studios are located at the bottom end of Ditchling Rise (on the one way section). Go through the large blue gates signposted 'Beaconsfield Studios and Workshops'. The entrance is located at the back of the garage area.

An alternative entrance is at 63 Beaconsfield Villas (underneath the viaduct opposite Choice Vehicle Rentals). From the Duke of Yorks Cinema walk towards the viaduct on Beaconsfield Villas and take the first left into Ditchling Rise for front entrance or carry on to the viaduct for the rear entrance. Unit 9 is located upstairs......just follow the signs.
description: A fabulous glass studio, showcasing a vibrant collection of kiln-formed glass artworks. On show will be gorgeous glass bowls, panels, framed glass pictures and sculptural pieces.  Also on display will be striking contemporary jewellery designs, unique screen printed T-shirts, prints and cards, beautiful illustrations and handmade leather goods. Come along and be amazed!

Stephanie Else Fused glass
Sebastian Bolivar Handmade jewellery
Inky Biscuits Silkscreen printing
Graham Whitaker Leatherwork
Dawn Elizabeth Williams Illustration

the-cicada-house-2.name: The Cicada House
direction: Stanmer Villas is on the no. 50 bus route, which runs from Churchill Square in central Brighton.The closest stop to 30 Stanmer Villas is about 50 yards up the road on the same side. If driving from central Brighton go up Ditchling Road to the Fiveways junction and turn right into Hollingbury Road, sharp left into Hollingbury Place and second left into Stanmer Villas. No. 30 is about 100 yards up the road on the right. If driving into Brighton on the A23 turn left at the major set of traffic lights into Preston Drove and continue up the hill to the Fiveways junction. Drive straight over into Hollingbury Road (Fiveways Pub on the left, Maslens Estate Agents on the right). If you are using Satnav or smart phone enter postcode BN1 7HP. If all else fails then please don't hesitate to ring us on 01273 550714 for directional advice!
description:
For the 21st time The Cicada House is open to all, an Aladdin’s cave of affordable art, showcasing Nick Orsborn’s paintings, prints and Cicada Jewellery, plus the work of 20 guest artists.
Indoor and outdoor ceramics, glass, contemporary felting, textiles, mosaics, artists cards and more! A visual delight!
For more info, visit Nick’s website and the Fiveways Artists’ website, where the guest artists are listed and where images of their work can be seen and appreciated.
Also open on Bank Holiday Monday 29th. A warm and friendly welcome guaranteed!

the-handmade-house-4.name: The Handmade House
description: This May we open our pop-up shop and garden cafe with a host of artists showing work both in the shop and out in the garden. On the last long weekend we launch The Handmade House Mini Art Fair, a new event with lots of stalls in the garden selling local arts and craft, pizzas, food stalls, plants, as well as games for the kids and plenty of live music.

Guy Holder Sculpture

Keep it local, Keep it simple, Make it beautiful.

peggy-poppletons-shop-2.name: Peggy Poppleton & Friends
description: Reliably delightful, colourful and even glamourous, pop in to Peggy’s to enjoy the work of some of Sussex’s finest artists and designers.

make-arts-collective.name: MAKE Arts Collective
direction: We are at the opposite end of St Patrick's to Riverside Supported Living, at the bell tower end. If you're standing on Western Road facing north we are at the furthest end away from you.
description: MAKE Arts Collective presents Faces of Brighton and Hove, an exhibition of work showing the diversity of the city, by artists passionate about the local area and it’s unique identity.

Christy Summerton Mixed media
Jessica Goodall Portraiture
Tamara Jackson Oil and mixed media
Lucy Burrows Sculpture
Esther Bishop Photography
Maria Scard Photography

the-claremont-4.name: The Claremont
description: We are delighted to house a wonderfully diverse collection of work including photography, ceramics, metals, paintings, glass, screen-printing, mixed media, knitted and sewn pieces, by over thirty artists (for a complete list, see our website).

Our beautiful Victorian Villa is itself a work of art with original period features and walled garden. Free tea and homemade cake tasters available from 12pm to 5pm, or upgrade to a Cream Tea by advance booking on our website.

the-wellbeing-gallery-2.name: The Wellbeing Gallery
direction: Catch any bus running along Western Road will find you quickly yourself at Brighton Health and Wellbeing Centre (1, 1A, 2, 2A, 5, 5A, 5B, 6, 24, 25, 46, 49, 49A, 81). From Brighton train station, just hop on the number 6 bus towards Hove. Pay by phone parking is available in the area all around the centre. Better still walk, bike or skate your way along the seafront and head up towards Western Road.
description: Beloved: A diverse group of artists share what beloved means to them, at our pop-up gallery based at an innovative health centre.

Aradne Textiles
Natasha Bidgood Photography
Stephen Hawthorne Painting
Stephen Humphrey Painting
Pete Mountford Photography
Luc Raesmith Assemblage
Anthony Stevens Textiles
Also showing paperworks and a film from the project Finding Your Compass and writing from the Narrative Workshops.

no-35-2.name: No.35
description: Mother and daughter exhibit together at No. 35, the home and studio of ali Stringell.

Meryl’s landscapes reflect her love of colour and light. She embraces the monotones of winter as well as the warmer hues of summer. In her still life paintings, she plays with image and design, whilst composing on the canvas.
ali works primarily with fine silver and other unexpected elements to produce contemporary silverware and sculptures. ali is a member of Handmade in Britain and CAA, London.
ali is planning to open No.35 as a Gallery of Contemporary Art & Craft.

kellie-miller-arts-gallery-3.name: Kellie Miller Arts Gallery
direction: Located in the prestigious Brighton Lanes opposite Nile Street and Costa Coffee. Car parking in Lanes underground car park on Black Lion Street.
description: Transcendence is an exhibition exploring the magical essence of art and celebrating the handmade. Curated by artist and gallery owner Kellie Miller in her contemporary gallery in the heart of the Brighton Lanes, where she exhibits artworks from over 35 award winning UK and international artists.

Featured artists are:
Alice Sheppard Fidler Landscape paintings
Kellie Miller New prints
Elizabeth Price Sculptures
Sarah Villeneau Sculptures
Jane Skingley Still life paintings

metagraph.name: Metagraph
description:
Jem Ryan Sculpture
Caroline Minogue Jewelry
Jacqueline Rana Installation
Louisa Newbury Painting
Giuseppe Iozzi Painting

ming-art-gallery.name: Ming Art Gallery
description:
Ming Art Gallery is a new art exhibition space in East Hove near Seven Dials, which opened in October 2016. The gallery combines East Asian and Western aesthetics, art works and gifts. On display are contemporary paintings, prints and ceramics from local Brighton and Hove artists and traditional Asian gifts, crafts and calligraphy. The gallery also hosts art workshops, art classes and art events.

Emma Bennett Painting and art cards
Claire Harrison Painting
Lauren Nickless  Painting and art cards
Jules J. Foreman Mixed media collage
Georgina Major  Painting and jewellery
Zoe Lakshmi Ceramic art
Gabriele Ghiani Ceramic sculpture
Jo-Anna Rawlings Textile sculpture and handicrafts
Suzie Warren Painting
Tina Zheng Painting

reflections-of-the-divine.name: Reflections of the Divine
description: Committed to interfaith and multicultural dialogue, we are presenting an exhibition of multi-media works inspired by Jewish, Islamic, Daoist and Christian traditions. The art represents contemporary expressions of the sacred, using traditional methods and materials, brought to life through the artists’ unique perspectives of the divine.
Artists talks: Sundays 3.30pm
Andrew Franks Paintings and other works inspired by Islamic traditional art
Sandra Hill Small paintings inspired by Daoism
Tracy Wideman Christian icons
Jess Wood Jewish paintings and icons

coloured-clay-ceramics.name: Coloured Clay Ceramics
direction: Situated on the north/south high street.
description:
Crispin McNally will be exhibiting coloured clay ceramics in a Grade II Listed house in Ditchling. This work is made using Nerikomi technique which involves staining porcelain to produce coloured clay. This clay is used to form tableware, jewellery and buttons. All work is fired to 1220 degrees centigrade.

Entrance to the house is on the high street.

There is little immediate parking, but parking can be found throughout the village. Restroom facilities available.

jane-faires.name: Jane Faires
direction: From the Pier go north past the Pavilion, follow the signs to the A270 (Lewes Road).  Franklin Road is on the right just before the Franklin Arms Pub, and 65d is on the right.
description: Jane’s figurative paintings are in a free, bright, colourful and sometimes wild style. They are inspired by the natural world and animals, both real and mythological, capturing their characters with humour and warmth. Jane works in jewel like colours on canvas or board in both oils and acrylics.  Her paintings are highly collectable, joyful and full of light.

life-in-the-city.name: Life in the City
direction: From the Old Steine head East up St James's Street. Dorset Gardens is the second road on the left. The church building is on the left, next to the flats adjacent to the Peace Park.
description: An exhibition of Tony Tree’s photographs of Faith Groups, taken throughout the city in 2000 and recently updated. Alongside associated submitted poetry on the theme An Inclusive City. Also Janina Karpinska’s poetry workshop (booking essential) and poetry reading on 20th May. All housed in an award-winning, modern, light building.

Tony Tree Monochrome photographs of Faith Groups in the city
Jason Evans Poetry
Janina Karpinska Poetry
Selwyn Veater Poetry

st-michaels-all-angels.name: St Michael’s Church
direction: St Michael's is in the Clifton Hill area of  Brighton, near to the Seven Dials Roundabout and only a 10 minute walk from the Railway Station and City Centre. Buses to Waitrose in Western Road or Churchill Square (all routes) up Montpelier Road, turn right into Victoria Road; or buses from the station to Seven Dials (7,14C, 22,77, etc.,) and walk down Vernon Terrace and turn left into Victoria Road.
description: A wonderful opportunity to see individual works by Paula Dickinson, oil on card or board, in a spectacularly beautiful setting. The ‘Cathedral of the Backstreets’, St Michael’s is Grade I Listed, consisting of two churches made one. The first designed by Bodley, built in 1861-62, now forms the south aisle of the cathedral-like nave, completed in 1893-95 by Burges, including fine architecture, sculpture and woodwork, with magnificent Pre-Raphaelite stained glass windows by William Morris, Burne-Jones et al, and in the north aisle by Kempe & Tower.

fleurs-cottage.name: Fleurs Cottage
direction: Bristol Gardens is above Sussex Square, at the eastern end of Kemptown.
description: A delightful cottage on the Kemptown Trail presents an eclectic exhibition of watercolour paintings, still life photography, Brighton Pride photography and vintage-inspired handmade millinery, with a selection of original art, prints and cards.

Christa Hook Watercolours
Jason Hook Street photography
Pyewacket Millinery Sculptural handmade hats
Chris Thomas Still life photography
Tea and cake available to enjoy in the garden, with occasional sketching demonstrations and live acoustic music.

rebel-yarns-50-southampton-st.name: Rebel Yarns: 50 Southampton St
description: Rebel Yarns: meaningful knitting and crochet by Dani Ahrens.

A one-off chance to see a collection of knitted and crocheted works by local art activist Dani Ahrens. From intricate, personalised gifts to public and playful crocheted graffiti, these unique pieces convey mathematical and political ideas with wit and skill.

On Saturday 13th May 2-4pm, the house will host a Make it Happen: Homes for Refugees drop-in workshop, with the Hummingbird Project. Visitors are invited to imagine, create, design, draw, knit, paint, make, assemble…homes for refugees.

colour-laine-2.name: Colour Laine
direction: Five minutes from Brighton Station, Queen's Gardens is in the North Laine and has Leo Frames at one end, and La Choza at the other. Keep an eye out for the colourful house!
description: For the 5th year running, Jess, Toby and Zoe will be opening the doors to exhibit for Colour Laine: a hidden gem in the North Laine for those who love colour in spadefuls.

This townhouse with a vibrant interior, showcases Zoe Murphy’s screen-printed furniture and textiles from Margate and Mexico (Liberty of London, Kirstie’s Vintage Home) and Toby ‘fotobes’ Mason’s Lomographic film photography (BBC, Urban Outfitters, Guardian Life & Style).
Shortlisted for Best Open House 2015 and 2016.
All served with resident chef Jess Mason’s (Drinks Maven) home cooked treats.

the-uncommon-market.name: The Uncommon Market
direction: Coming into Brighton on the A23 St John's church is before Preston Drive and Preston Park on your left. Coming from the Fiveways down Preston Drive, turn right and St John's is on your right. Preston Park train station is 5 min walk from St John's.
description: The Uncommon Market features a new stained glass window for St John’s, The Light of the World by Annelies Clarke. It will be dedicated on 21 May by the Bishop of Chichester

Annelies Clarke Paintings, stained glass and live 15-minute portraits

Live music, Saturdays 5.30-6.30pm

fugitive-ink-2.name: Fugitive Ink

description: Fugitive Ink returns with lovely artwork lit by floor-to-ceiling bay windows on the first floor of a tree-lined Victorian avenue.  A great way to see some fine paintings, drawings, stitchings, etchings, ceramics and more.

one-sussex-mews-2.name: One Sussex Mews
direction: One Sussex Mews is situated off Eastern Road in Kemp Town, Brighton. It is directly opposite the Spire (aka St Marks Church).

By no. 1 or 7 bus, get off at St. Mary's Hall. Look for the large white arch on the opposite side of the road, this is the entrance to Sussex Mews. If you find yourself in Sussex Square walk back to the Spire. Marmalade Cafe is opposite Rock St. which runs parallel to Sussex Mews. Please note! There is no entrance to One Sussex Mews in Rock Street.
description:
Caroline Austin Paintings and prints
Maggie Barradell Paintings and prints

Sally Henry Prints and polyhedra light sculpture

Welcome to our Kemptown studio. Meet artists and designers at work. A varied collection of paintings, original prints and polyhedra light sculptures.

Easy access by walking, with the map to guide you, come through the white archway (opposite the new Spire Arts Centre) into the Mews, we are first on the left.

south-heighton-pottery-2.name: South Heighton Pottery
direction: Turn off the A26 into South Heighton (1 mile from Newhaven).  The Pottery is 100m. on your right.
description: With its beautiful spring garden, delicious food and pots, paintings and sculpture of the highest quality, South Heighton Pottery makes a great festival destination. This year Chris will be showing paintings for the first time, together with a new kiln-full of his pots.

Chris Lewis Ceramics, sculpture and painting
Gabrielle Moore Small abstract oil paintings

Rachael Akester Hobby horses

brighton-etch-cornerhouse.name: Brighton Etch Cornerhouse
direction: We are on the corner of Stanford Avenue and Beaconsfield Villas.
Bus routes: 5, 5a, 5b, 56
description: Brighton Etch fine art printmakers Jo and Heike have joined forces with talented artists and makers to create a vibrant exhibition of exquisite works of art and craft. We welcome visitors to our ground floor Open House, with tea and cake in the garden provided by Jane Harvell and Jay Curtis (with the help of some cake fairies).

Heike Roesel Etchings and watercolours

thebigforest-emporium-4.name: TheBigForest Emporium
direction: Chester Terrace is in Fiveways and can either be approached from Preston Drove or Stanford Avenue.
description: Enter the wondrous world of TheBigForest, two silly artist makers – Mr Rowling and Mr Craven. We are turning our front parlour into a seaside emporium of delights.
Expect to find our Brighton Men paper dolls, beautifully detailed felt dogs, cut out camper-van and Brighton Beard cards; sailor bears, animal mobiles and work by pop-up artists too!

brush.name: BRUSH
direction: Top of the hill/ opposite the back of the Post Office
description: Brush gallery returns with a dynamic selection of Brighton-based fine artists. Expect live art, workshops, artist talks, live music, brownies from award winning Twit Twoo Bakery and much more.

studio-59.name: Studio 59
direction: On the corner of Norton Road and Blatchington Road. Norton Road has a carpark opposite Hove Town Hall. Easily accessed from Hove Station, buses 5, 5b, 7, 49 and 6.
description:
Come to see an intriguing collection in a light-filled studio in a Victorian Arts and Crafts villa. Mysterious figures fill the space; paintings from old photos evoke stories of displacement and the distance of memories; and in the centre, ceramic animal/human figures convey intriguing narratives, influenced by Trickster mythologies. Delicate and precise experimental prints hint at one of the artist’s background in architecture. And if you’re lucky, you may be in time for home baking with coffee!

Dianka Paintings
Ewa Cobel Prints
Saya McNairn-Yanagi Ceramic sculpture

preston-park-recovery-centre-2.name: Preston Park Recovery Centre
direction: Preston Park Avenue runs alongside Preston Park, the Centre is based about half way along the Avenue facing the park.
description: Southdown Mental Health Recovery Services present a diverse and vibrant mix of painting, sculpture, photography and film. The work is displayed in Preston Park Recovery Centre, a double fronted Victorian Villa overlooking the park. The exhibition is curated by local artist Judy Martin. This is our third year of participating in the festival showcasing the work of many talented artists who use the Recovery Services. The exhibition aims to build bridges between our artists and the wider community of Brighton and Hove

for-the-man-i-love-3.name: For the Man I Love
description: We will be featuring an amazing selection of items For the Man You Love, including grooming, accessories, menswear, sports, hobbies and home and garden. All of our artists will also be featured on our website.

trails-end-no-5-2.name: Trail’s End @ No.5
direction: On the east side of Sussex Square, facing the sea.
description: Come and discover the history of this lovely house by the sea and the beautiful work that will be inhabiting it for the merry – hopefully sunny – month of May!
We are happy to present work by William De Belleroche, who lived at No.5 in the 50s and 60s, as well as new work by old friends and new neighbours.

Serena Sussex Oil paintings on canvas
Alberto Martinez Surreal paintings
Swann Forge Bespoke ironwork

oxford-st-nick-fords-studio.name: Oxford Street – Nick Ford’s Studio
direction: A stone's throw from The Level & London Road, a five minute walk from the back of Brighton Station, and round the corner from The Open Market.
description: Nick Ford and guest artists welcome you to The Studio to celebrate the coming of age of the Beyond The Level Trail. Fantastic work is showcased to commemorate this 21 year milestone, including a guest appearance by The Beyond The Level logo designer, Caroline della Porta!

Nick Ford Metallic photographic prints
Caroline della Porta Illustrator
Judy Alexander Mixed media
Susan Shehadie Multimedia collage
Chris Millard Drawing and painting
Candida Lloyd Ceramics

ruth-mulvie.name: Ruth Mulvie
direction: You will find us on the right hand side of Brunswick Square as you are looking away from the Sea.
description: Think intoxicatingly fun and vivid snapshots of utopian wonderlands, filled with women, animals, a pure, infinite sense of glamour and perfect freedom and you’re almost there. With her intricately constructed, dreamlike sensoryscapes, Ruth has the world of make-belief sassiness, vivacious colourways and grace notes in kitsch at her feet, gold VW Beetle included.

Following on from her sell out show last October, Ruth Mulvie is proud to  launch her latest collection of paintings and prints Garden of Earthly Delights as part of the Brighton Artists Open Houses. The name for Ruth’s up-coming show pays homage to the early Netherlandish master Hieronymus Bosch’s triptych painting of the same name.

brighton-belles.name: Lady Allsorts
description:
Monotypes of Lady Allsorts and Brighton Belles developed from quick drawings done here, there and everywhere!  Jane’s colours interact to form simplified bright images with a sense of humour!  Prints available framed and unframed.

Come and see Jane at work in her sunny garden flat!

danny-house.name: ‘Maison de Papier’
direction: By train - Hassocks station - Turn right out of the station car park; walk up to/straight across 'Stone pounds' cross roads (toward Hurstpierpoint); follow the directions below; nb. it’s about 1.5 miles to Danny; taxis are available from: Five Star Taxis 01273 846666
By Bus - From Brighton (Churchill sq) no. 273 https://bustimes.org.uk/stops/4400MS0197
nearest (request) stop is Hurstpierpoint (opp. College Lane) https://bustimes.org.uk/stops/4400MS0197
Follow the sharp bend toward Hurstpierpoint village; turn left into New Way Lane; follow the directions below.

By car - From Brighton - Take the A23 (toward London, Crawley, Gatwick); stay in the left hand lane; take the first exit (A273) toward Hassocks; pass through Pyecombe; pass the South Downs Nursery on your right hand side; at 'Stone pounds' cross roads turn left toward Hurstpierpoint; on the first sharp bend left (just after College road) turn left on to New Way Lane; before the end of the cul-de-sac turn right (New Way lane contd); turn immediately right; follow the white arrow marked ‘Danny’; follow the drive.

From London - From the M23/A23, take the slip road exit marked to Hurstpierpoint and Hickstead show-ground; go through Sayers Common to the traffic lights at Albourne; turn left onto B2116.; follow this road right through the village; turn right into New Way Lane; as above. Please park in front of the house. For more information please see: www.dannyhouse.org.uk/
description: Artist Stephanie Smart creates life-size garments and footwear using only paper and thread. This is her first collection of historical fashion  and is inspired by the lives of past and present residents of Danny House. This exhibition will appeal not only to lovers of art and craft, but to those with an interest in Britain’s social/cultural history. The beautiful Grade 1 Elizabethan mansion that is Danny House is opening as a festival Open House for the first time in 2017.
Stephanie Smart Embroidered paper

A limited number of black tie Private View invites are available on request, for the evening of Saturday 6th May.
Please email – strictly by invite only.

inlight-glass-fusion.name: Inlight Glass Fusion
direction: Situated in a Mews just off Second Avenue. Enter Second Avenue from Church Road, first Mews on the left next to "La Fourchette".
description: A warm welcome to this studio/gallery, showcasing a stunning collection of unique, contemporary kiln formed glass, by glass artist Chantal Mesnard. Find out about the popular creative glass workshops Chantal runs throughout the year. The studio is situated in a picturesque mews near Palmeira Square and a short stroll away from the seafront.
Chantal Mesnard Contemporary glass fusion

description: Come and join us in our enchanting studio tucked away in a garden setting. We are delighted to open our doors again, showcasing prints by Bryony Rimmington Jones and collagraphs by Niyati Barlow, as well as beautiful designer hats and bow ties by Lucy Barlow/Mr Bow Dandy. Also showing jewellery by Emma Willcocks.

hummingbird-studio-2.name: Hummingbird Studio

Paintings and prints by Bar Spurr and her students. Ceramic animals, sculptures and pottery by Bebe Bird, Chris Hesketh, and Deryn Bell. Silver Jewellery by Vee Pease. Silk hair pieces and jewellery by Cuttlefishlove and Carrie Donohue’s fabric collaged and embroidered booklets, bags and brooches.

the-stanley-road-store-3.name: The Stanley Road Store

17-adelaide-crescent.name: 17 Adelaide Crescent, Hove
description: “Sky rockets in the night, neon rainbows on the blink and a dawn chorus of raspberries by a series of candy-coloured clowns. Ewan McDougall’s amped-up paintings leave you in no doubt about where they’re coming from; they are saturated in the musical noise of mass culture, but the tune they’re playing is slightly off-key, rife with dissonance and dissent”.
Break on Through David Eggleton – Art New Zealand. No.108

“…his paintings are far more than a personal biography. They’re contemporary and timeless in what  they have to say about our desires and behaviours. McDougall’s art gets to the heart of such matters, revealing the joys, tragedies and paradoxes of the lives of the frantic and blissful figures inhabiting his paintings”
Sensual, tactile and loud Dr Warren Feeny – Art News, New Zealand. Spring 2016
Ewan McDougall shows vibrant oil impasto paintings, along with Man Alive a short film about the artist.
Also books and poetry by Sarah McDougall and a CD of original rock music by Will McDougall.

metamorphosis.name: Mackenzie Bell – Paintings
direction: Victoria Place is situated mid-way between Victoria Street & Montpelier Street
description:
Mackenzie Bell studied Fine Art at Exeter, Brighton and Central St. Martins. He taught Art in Los Angeles and Sydney and was Head of Art at St. Paul’s College in Mid Sussex. In 1997 he left teaching to pursue a passion for painting and landscape garden design. He moved to Cornwall to create a five-acre water garden, taking Monet’s ‘Giverny’ as a source of inspiration.

After four years of intensive work with his partners, Northwood Water Gardens were created, comprising nine spring fed lakes, islands, streams, bridges and waterfalls, and introducing thousands of specimen trees and shrubs. Mackenzie describes the gardens as his ever evolving, three dimensional organic painting (see website photographs).

His garden designs have featured in several publications and  television programmes. A studio and gallery were built within the gardens and Mackenzie has progressively established himself as one of Cornwall’s prominent painters, exhibiting in several solo and group shows.

His work features in private collections in Europe, Canada and the U.S.A. This is his first solo show in Brighton where he now mainly lives. Works are presented within a splendid garden house, set within an enchanting walled garden.

Prices range from £65 to £2000, using mixed media on canvas. Cards are also available.

” Wonderfully sensitive work as the artist explores the linear qualities of structure and texture with audacity and maturity. Mackenzie’s paintings are inspired as they assault our senses with astonishing vitality, energy and colour”
…art critic, Western Morning News

Bank Holiday weekend only: Sat 27, Sun 28, Mon 29th May

the-trojan-house-3.name: The Trojan House
direction: Directions to The Trojan House:
from M23 A23 London:

As you come to the end of the A23 make sure you're in the lefthand lane, keep in the lefthand lane signposted to Worthing & Hove (it's a special lane which avoids the big roundabout and sortof Ubends left onto the A27 heading towards Worthing).
Keep in the lefthand lane on the A27 and turn off the A27 at the first exit sign posted Hove.
When you get to the Roundabout at the top of the slip road, take the 2nd turnoff signposted ‘Brighton’ (this is Dyke Road Avenue which turns into Dyke Road as you drive along it).
Keep driving into Brighton till you see a bushy tree-lined brick housing development on your left (this is The Beeches & Hazeldene Meads).
Just past this you’ll see Withdean Ave on your left, take the next left which is Tivoli Crescent North (the houses at the turnoff have traditional flint walls).
The first right is Maldon Road. The Trojan House is number 26.
from A27 Lewes:
Ignore the turn off to Brighton and follow the signs to Hove & Devils Dyke. Turn off the A27 at the Hove Exit.
When you get to the Roundabout, take the 2nd turnoff signposted ‘Brighton’ (this is Dyke Road Avenue which turns into Dyke Road as you drive along it).
Keep driving into Brighton till you see a bushy tree-lined brick housing development on on your left (this is The Beeches & Hazeldene Meads).
Just past this you’ll see Withdean Ave on your left, take the next left which is Tivoli Crescent North (the houses at the turn off have traditional flint walls).
The first right is Maldon Road. The Trojan House is number 26.
from A27 Worthing:
Take the turnoff to Hove & Devils Dyke (this comes before the Brighton turn off!)
This takes you to the Devils Dyke Roundabout where you should turn right.

You will immediately come to another Roundabout where you should go straight ahead taking the turning signposted ‘Brighton’ (this is Dyke Road Avenue which turns into Dyke Road as you drive along it).
Keep driving into Brighton till you see a bushy tree-lined brick housing development on on your left (this is The Beeches & Hazeldene Meads).
Just past this you’ll see Withdean Ave on your left, take the next left which is Tivoli Crescent North (the houses at the turnoff have traditional flint walls).
The first right is Maldon Road. The Trojan House is number 26.
From Seven Dials:
Turn off Seven Dials Roundabout onto Dyke Road heading north towards Devils Dyke.

You will pass Dyke Road Park on your left, the Booth Museum on your right, Tesco Express on your left and The Dyke Tavern on your right. Keep going, not far past the Dyke Tavern you will see the Church of the Good Shepherd on your right.
Take the second turning after the Church of the Good Shepherd which is Matlock Road.
Maldon Road is the first left. The Trojan House is number 26.

direction: The Friends' Meeting House is on Ship Street, just off North Road, and on the edge of The Laines. It is on the corner where Ship Street meets Prince Albert Street.
description: An exhibition for browsers and collectors. This print sale will celebrate Lee Miller‘s estate printer Carole Callow and her dedication to the Archives in the final month before she hangs up her darkroom apron, retiring after 35 years. Carole Callow and Antony Penrose will host gallery talks at 1pm and 3pm on both Sundays.

Lee Miller (1907-1977) began her career as a New York fashion model. She later worked with Man Ray in Paris, ran her own portrait studio in New York and lived in Egypt, before becoming a photojournalist during WWII and settling in Sussex.

christopher-gunson.name: Christopher Gunson
description: From Pigment To Light

Christopher Gunson is an award winning designer and Illustrator, having studied Fine Art (painting). Working with Creation Records, he created the iconic Going Blank Again album cover for indie band Ride. He has written and illustrated many children’s books, including the award-winning Over On The Farm, part of the government’s Book Start scheme, ensuring every child received a free book.

Christopher is involved in photographic projects, ranging from event photography to fashion shoots. With Chelsea and Kensington council he is developing a project, teaching photography to families who are dealing with issues ranging from domestic abuse to teenagers living with Aids.
His Battersea Power Station series is being exhibited as part of the first stage completion celebrations of this Iconic building’s redevelopment.
If you’d like to talk to Chris about his work please come and say hello at the Open House festival.

direction: 5 mins walk from Western Road and just round the corner from Seven Dials
description: Contemporary environmental art exhibition by La Rosa.

La Rosa is from the Nariño region of Colombia. As a gatherer and recycler of things, she identifies with Wombles. Her work uses a range of recycled materials to explore our relationship with the environment.

The series on display includes:
Animals in Space Portraits of an animal underclass.
Richmond  Projection of our disintegrated experience onto the deer resident in the park.
Namimales Investigation of the degradation of the natural environment in Namibia.

direction: Off Edward Street, Kemptown
description: Somewhere Over the Rainbow…
Not just pictures hanging on a living room wall – straight from Tate Modern, SEAS will exhibit the provocative installation The New Union Flag by Gil Mualem Doron.

Alongside, a spaceship will incorporate works by pupils from St Luke’s, St Mary’s, St John, and Balfour Primary Schools. The Migrant English Project’s members will exhibit a series of collages on ceramics, and Louise Purbrick (University of Brighton) and Elaine Ortiz (Hummingbird Project) will display the project !Make it Happen!: Homes for Refugees.

Works for sale, artists’ talks and workshops. The exhibition is supported by Sanctuary on Sea and Platforma – arts and refugee network. Schools & Group visits can be arranged for weekdays by appointment.

streat-place-barn.name: Streat Place Barn
direction: By car please follow the Art In Ditchling map and not a SatNav (which bring you along an unmade farm track). From the Ditchling crossroads take the B2116 towards Lewes (The Post Office and The Bull car park will be on your left hand side). After approx 1 mile you pass through the West Meston village and after approx 1 further mile take a left turn, with a house on the corner, onto Streat Lane. Follow Streat Lane for approx 1.25 miles - at the top of a hill take a sharp left turn onto an unmade track (a red telephone box and Streat Church are on this corner). Follow the track, taking the first right and on your left hand side is the gate to Streat Place Barn. You may park in the Barnyard or neatly on the unmade track.
description: Enjoy the wonderfully rural setting of Streat Place Barn, restored single-handedly over many years, which is again opening its big Barn doors to everyone in May!

Viewing also possible by appointment.

A series of new canvases and paperworks capturing the South Downs from walks near Lewes will be the main theme of her work this year. Also her series of seascapes will be exhibited as part of ongoing work linked to West Cornwall.

direction: Off Western Road near Waitrose
description: Sick Nature: seven contemporary artists responses to the idea of the natural at John Constable’s studio. Constable knew William Blake and they talked over drawings. Taking Blake’s poem The Sick Rose as a point of departure, artists will explore the unnatural in painting.
Artists include Natasha Kissell, Peter Harrap, David Freud & Debbi Mason, Alan Rankle, Gregory Smart and Amy Alderson.
Peter Harrap has also curated Constable and Brighton which is held at Brighton Museum  April 8th – October 8th 2017

Comments from May 2016:
‘very atmospheric paintings, with great depth.’
‘ beautiful and inspiring, great work! ‘
‘ back for third year running, a delight, a feast and inspiring!’
This year Vanessa showcases some special guests and craftspeople, including Sussex’s own Brontebags, handmade leather bags and goods, crafted with love pride and a boho vibe.

cameron-contemporary-art-4.name: Cameron Contemporary Art
description: Since opening in Hove in 2013 Cameron Contemporary has established itself as one of the most exciting independent galleries in Sussex.  The gallery is dedicated to showing a changing programme of high quality established and exciting up and coming British artists. Ranging from traditional to modern, figurative to abstract, each exhibition is accompanied by a selection of sculpture, ceramics and jewellery.
Our May exhibition;  Festival 2017 showcases many of our favourite gallery artists and makers and is always one of our most popular exhibitions of the year.

We hold around eight exhibitions annually and continue to exhibit at leading UK Art Fairs. We also have a programme of talks and events in the gallery ranging from tastings to talks and even evenings of theatre. Join our mailing list to be kept up to date with what is coming next.

description:
This year we’ve curated a selection of artists whom we have got to know and love over the past 12 months. All artists are locally based and compliment the Homage Scandi aesthetic:
Hello Marine: celebrated graphic artist and print maker. Marine creates bold and joyful illustrations.
Potters Thumb: studio pottery by local ceramicist Mark Ciavola. Hand made, wheel thrown tableware.

direction: Redhill Drive is off Valley Drive which is off the top end of Dyke Road Avenue. We are close to the A27 to Lewes/Worthing and the A23 to London. Also close is the Withdean Sports Centre and Park & Ride location for Brighton.
description: ‘World-class art at village prices,’ that sums up AfricArt. Contemporary stone sculptures from Southern Africa rub shoulders with art, metalwork and textiles from West Africa. Old and new masters represented.
Exhibited alongside is Bob Webzell’s stunning photography inspired by the Luminous Continent. Exotic yet affordable jewellery by Palomita adds an extra sparkle.
Feeling creative yourself? Make your own masterpiece in one of our African stone sculpting workshops using serpentine stone specially brought over from Africa. Booking essential.

description: Jenny KilBride Weaving

Jane Skelton and students from her studio in Streat will be showcasing the wide variety of uses clay can be put to – there will be pots, models, sculptures – some for indoors, some to use, some for the garden and some to just admire.

cecil-rice-4.name: Cecil Rice
description: Cecil looks forward to welcoming you to his Edwardian home and studio at Seven Dials, just 10 minutes walk from Brighton station. Cecil is one of Brighton’s most celebrated artists. His work is constantly evolving, fusing representation and abstraction to capture the eternal quality of light.

Come and meet the artist and discover thirty new oil paintings and watercolours of Brighton, Venice, Italy and India. Featuring the Palace Pier at twilight, sunlight at Stanmer woods, the fading beauty of Venice and the Tuscan summer.
Browse through a fascinating collection of affordable fine art silkscreen prints, giclees, books and cards.
For a sneak preview of the show please visit our website.

direction: Ditchling village is Eight miles North of Brighton and West of Lewes; we are right on the crossroads opposite the Bull pub.
description: Pruden and Smith are designers and craftsmen in precious metals whose passion for contemporary design shows in everything they do. Their gallery and new display area within, their adjoining workshops, on Ditchling Crossroads showcases their work in gold, platinum, and silver incorporating diamonds and unusual gemstones from all over the world. This year look out for new designs featuring 2000 year old Roman glass from Afghanistan.  They offer a complete design-to-make service for any item in precious metal from engagement rings to chalices. They can also incorporate or redesign your existing jewellery in a process they call ‘A Precious Legacy’.

Designer Rebecca Smith takes inspiration and materials from your existing jewellery collection to generate designs for new pieces. It ensures that your jewellery is out of your jewellery box and worn whilst maintaining the sentimental connection to past pieces. Many of the designs on display are to generate ideas for this process.

During the festival take a tour of their workshops of 30 years, then follow with a look at their history by visiting Ditchling Museum of Art and Craft, which features the work and tools of Anton Pruden’s grandfather, Dunstan, silversmith on The Guild of St Joseph and St. Dominic.

capital-landscapes.name: Capital landscapes
direction: Buses 26, 46, 56, 79 to Fiveways.
From Fiveways junction, walk 50m north up Ditching Rd. Turn left onto Hythe Rd (HSBC on corner). Disabled street parking bay nearby.
description: With Brexit looming, the City of London hopes to become Europe’s low-tax offshore haven, with public services disappearing as rapidly as inequality increases. Whether your response is to say “That’s capital!” or “That’s capitalism!,” come and take a look at some works that respond to our changing economic system and its devastating reach. We won’t seize your assets but we hope to capture your imagination and stir you to action.

Janet Sang Original screen prints
Marion Macalpine Photography
Nic Watts Graphics

grace-eyre-artists.name: Montefiore Open House
direction: From Seven Dials head down Dyke Road towards BHASVIC. Then turn left onto the Old Shoreham Road. We are on the left hand side opposite the playing fields between Montefiore and Avondale roads.
description: Grace Eyre Artists at Montefiore Open House are exhibiting a fresh and diverse range of work in a variety of media, to include painting, printing, textiles, photography, sculpture, mosaics, ceramics and knitted work. All the work in the exhibition is made by artists with learning disabilities and/or mental health needs.

blue-shed-studio.name: Blue Shed Studio
description: Celebrating its 10th Year,  The Blue Shed Studio will be exhibiting abstract sculpture and prints, lutherie, contemporary chairs made from English hardwoods, and ceramics. Photographs of recently completed architectural projects by sally williams architects will also be displayed.
The exhibition is sponsored by sally williams architects.

east-street.name: East Street
direction: Five minutes walk from the Royal Pavilion, near the seafront, and around the corner of Pool Valley Bus station. Purple door between restaurants Terre a Terre and Indian Summer
description: In the heart of Brighton’s Lanes, and with a lovely view of the sea, this display is mainly of my artwork: acrylic paintings on canvas, on a pre-texturised surface.
Visitors can also see and purchase interestingly composed photographs of Brighton and my India journey printed on postcard sized canvases.
Open Sundays only.

8-alexandra-villas.name: 8 Alexandra Villas
direction: From Seven Dials: Take the Dyke Road exit towards the town centre. Walk up the hill, and turn into Albert Road, which is the fourth turn on the left hand side. Half way down the street and take a right turn into Alexandra Villas. Number 8 is half way down on the right.

From Brighton Station: Walk out of the front of the station, and leave through the gates on the left hand side. Cross Terminus Road and walk up Guildford Road. At the top of Guildford Road, turn right and them immediately left onto Albert Road. Half way up Albert Road turn left onto Alexandra Villas.
description: My work ranges from delicate watercolour depictions of the South Downs to flamboyant expressive portraits of my family and friends, but a love of bold, bright colour and quick, energetic gestures is a unifying theme throughout my work. In my most recent work, I have been exploring ways of bringing humour and satirical elements into painting and illustration. Through my artwork, I look to recapture the sense of ease and curiosity that fuelled my work when I was a child.
Lily Webb Painter
